info.title: Frontend development in MIPS
info.description: This is team Frontend development in MIPS's API documentation, there are three main request method - two POST and one GET. The two POST methods are used for signup and login for user respectively, and the GET method is used for user to search reports. We have specified the Request body for both POST method and you can click the 'Schema' next to the 'Example value' for more details about the values for each fields. Similar for the returned json object, you can also find about the details about the values for each fields in the returned json object in the 'Schema'. Moreover, we have described the detailed information for each status code that could be possibly returned from the server for each method.

post.description: valid acount and password, if success will return a user token

post.summary: Signup with valid email and password.
post.description: The email should not be used for signup before.

email.description: A valid email that is not used for signup before

content.description: A message tells if the new user is signed up successfully
A message tells you that the signup error was about the email

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: token to be passed as a header

parameters.name: key_terms
parameters.description: key terms that be searched.(e.g. infectious disease)

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: the location where the disease happen.(e.g. China)

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: the start date of the disease.(e.g. 1995-01-01T00:00:00.000Z)

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: the end date of the disease.(e.g. 2030-01-01T00:00:00.000Z)

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: the start index of the list of the report (e.g. 0, 10)

200.description: A JSON array of user names

date_of_publication.description: The date of the publication of the report

main_text.description: The main content of the report

diseases.description: A list of diseases name that relevantto the report

reports.description: The relevant information about the content(diseases) of the report.

content.description: A message which will tell you which search terms are invalid
A message that says Missing token
A message says Invalid token error
